III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 5/25/24, Youth A and Youth B were drinking at the facility in
the bunkers and playing a game to see who could sustain the
most pain. Youth B took turns punching each other and Youth B
has swelling in the right side of the chest. The youth were not
being supervised.
Investigation This complaint was assigned on 05/28/2024 and investigated in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist.
Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 05/28/2024 and
reported they had no additional information.
Foster Care Worker 1 was interviewed via telephone on
05/28/2024. Foster Care Worker 1 reported he was notified of the
incident, and he does not have any concerns regarding the
agency.
Foster Care Worker 2 was notified of the investigation via email
on 05/29/2024.
Director was interviewed at the agency on 05/29/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Director reported on
05/25/2024 Youth A AWOLed and came back to the campus with
several small bottles of alcohol. Youth A initially said Youth D from
the SIL program gave him the alcoholic drinks, but now he is
refusing to say where he received the alcohol bottles from. He
said Youth A was outside and handed Youth B the alcoholic drinks
and Supervisor immediately followed Youth B on campus and took
away the alcoholic drinks. Director denied Youth A was in the
cottages drinking the alcoholic drinks. Director denied having
knowledge of any incidents involving Youths punching each other,
2

staff not supervising, or Youth B having swelling on the right side
of his chest.
Youth A was interviewed at the agency on 05/29/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A is 11 years old and
has been at the agency for 6 months. Youth A denied the
allegations and having any knowledge of youths punching each
other. Youth A insisted he has no knowledge of having any
alcohol on campus or in the cottages and walked out of the
interview room.
Youth B was interviewed at the agency on 05/29/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth B is 17 years old and
has been at the agency for one year. Youth B said he turns 18 in
July, and he will be transitioning to an Adult Foster Care (AFC)
home, but that’s not where he wants to go. Youth B wants to move
to Canada because in Canada you can drink and smoke at the
age of 18. Youth B reported on 05/28/2024 he saw Youth A
outside, so he went outside, and Youth A gave him two small
bottles of alcohol. He said Youth A told him he ran into Youth D on
Six Mile and Youth D gave him alcoholic drinks. Youth B took a
couple of sips and when staff came out, he ran but Supervisor
caught up with him and took the bottles of alcohol. Youth B denied
drinking the alcoholic drinks in the cottage. Youth B admitted to
playing around with Youth E and Youth F in the cottage by
punching each other. He said there is always staff supervising the
youth, staff do intervene and tell them to stop. Youth B reported it
does not hurt when they play around, and he denied have any
bruising or swelling on his chest.
Youth C was interviewed at the agency on 05/29/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth C has been at the
agency for 8 months. Youth C witnessed Youth A outside and
Youth B running away from Supervisor. Youth C followed Youth B
and when he and Supervisor caught up to him, Youth B had drunk
some of the alcohol. Youth C said Youth A told him he ran into
Youth D on Six Mile and Youth D gave him the alcoholic drinks.
Youth C denied seeing anyone (youth or staff) drinking alcohol in
the cottages. Youth C admitted to playing around with Youth B
and they would punch each other, but staff do redirect them to
stop. Youth C said staff are always in the cottage supervising
them.
Supervisor was interviewed at the agency on 05/29/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Supervisor recalled Youth A
had AWOLed around noon on 05/25/2024, and he had followed
3

him until line of sight was lost. He filed a police report and
returned to campus. Youth A returned to campus approximately
one hour later. Youth A and Youth B came around from behind the
cottage. Youth B took off running, while he was talking to Youth A.
He and Staff 1 followed Youth B and when they caught up with
him, they found Youth B had two small bottles of alcohol, one
bottle was still full, and one was empty. Youth A and Youth B
were taken to urgent care. Supervisor found Youth A had a bag
with 10 small bottles of Barefoot Moscato. Youth A told him he
obtained the bottles of alcohol from Youth D when he AWOLed.
Youth D is a in the SIL program on campus. Youth A and Youth
B’s rooms were searched, and nothing was found in the
bedrooms. Supervisor said Youth A and Youth B are not in the
same cottage and therefore he is not aware of any incidents
involving Youth A and Youth B punching each other.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the agency on 05/29/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 reported he arrived
on campus at 2:00PM for his shift on 05/25/2024, and therefore
did not witness the incident involving Youth A and Youth B. Staff 2
is not aware of any incident where youths were drinking alcohol in
the cottages. Staff 2 said there is always at least two to three staff
members in every cottage. He denied staff are not supervising or
allowing the youths to play around by punching each other. He
said staff always intervene if the youth horseplay.
Youth D was interviewed at the agency on 05/31/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth D is 18 years old and
is in the SIL program at the agency. Youth D reported he knows
Youth A, from being in residential placement prior to transition to
the SIL program. Youth D recalled running into Youth A on Six
Mile on 05/25/2024. Youth D said Youth A showed him a bag with
several bottles of alcoholic drinks inside. Youth D denied giving
Youth A alcohol. Youth D said he has never and would never give
a young kid alcohol. Youth D does not know where Youth A got
the alcohol from.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 05/31/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 is a direct care staff
and has been working at the agency for 11 years. Staff 1 recalled
the incident on 05/25/2024. Staff 1 reported Youth B walked out of
the agency on 05/25/2024, therefore he followed Youth B behind
the cottage, and that’s were Youth A and Youth B were found.
When he approached Youth B, he took off running. He and
Supervisor followed Youth B and Youth B was found to have two
4

bottles of alcoholic drinks. He denied the youths were inside the
cottages or any alcohol was found in the cottages.
Youth E and Youth F were interviewed at the agency on
06/04/2024. Youth E and Youth F both admitted to playing around
with Youth A by punching each other in the arms to see who can
handle the most punches. Youth E and Youth F reported that Staff
do intervene and make them stop. Both youths reported staff are
always supervising and did not express any concerns regarding
staff supervision. Youth E and Youth F denied any injuries as a
result.
Video Footage:
Reviewed video footage for approximately 12:00PM on
05/25/2024 was reviewed on 05/29/2024. Youth A was viewed
walking out of the cottage and Supervisor followed Youth A
outside.
Reviewed video footage for approximately 12:52PM on
05/25/2024 was reviewed on 05/29/2024. Youth A was viewed
outside the cottage and was searched by Supervisor.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 05/25/2024 completed by Supervisor
for Youth A’s AWOL. Incident report is consistent with
Supervisor’s interview.
• Incident report dated 05/25/2024 completed by Supervisor
for Youth B leaving the cottage. Incident report is consistent
with Supervisor’s interview.
• Agency AWOL policy. Staff are expected to make all efforts
to maintain eyesight of the youth(s). If youths leave the
grounds, staff should get a van and follow them. If youths
AWOL but stay on campus and go into the woods, staff
should contact the supervisor, follow calmly on foot, and
verbally attempt to return them. Staff must follow youths as
far as possible without endangering their own safety. If
youths retreat further into the woods and staff lose eyesight
of them, the police should be contacted, a missing person’s
report filed, and when a youth returns to campus notify
police.
• Agency policy: Child Supervision: 2. Agency schedules
staff to maintain a 4:1 ratio.
5

` The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews and video reviewed, Youth A had AWOLed and came
back to campus with alcohol bottles and provided the alcohol to
Youth B outside of the cottage.
Youths interviewed admitted to horse-playing, but staff were
supervising and redirecting youths not to horseplay.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
